Dialogue.Stage Direction: The entrance to the colony is futuristic, A crowd is watching a drum majorette perform to the accompaniment of a band. The whole place is like a holiday camp, with everyone smiling and enjoying themselves.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, splendid! Splendid! You've got a very good band there, Barney.
Thank you, Pilot.
Mind you, I don't say you'll come first at the festival, but never say die, what? Nothing succeeds like success. If at first you don't succeed
Try, try, try again!
That's right.
Stop him! Don't let him get out!
What's the matter? Medok!
Let me go!
This is very foolish of you, Medok. It's for your own good.
Out of my way!
He's far too dangerous to be allowed to escape. Get after him! You should have stopped him.
What happened, Ola?
He refused treatment in front of my guards so I dismissed them and he made a dash for it.
Well, get after him. He must not get away.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ola and the guards chase Medok, who runs through puddles and clambers over rocks to get away. He runs across some scrub then hides behind rocks and waits for the guards to pass. Then the Tardis materialises nearby. Medok eyes it suspiciously, and waits. The Doctor, Ben, Polly and Jamie come out.

Dialogue.Line: Hey!
Oh! Oh, Ben, for goodness sake.
Well, what's the big stick for, Jamie? Nothing's happened yet.
Have you no sense? Have you forgotten what we saw on that time scanner?
Don't. It was horrible.
Aye. Well, I'm not being left without nothing to defend ourselves with.
I'm afraid you're wasting your time, Jamie.
Why?
Unless I'm very much mistaken, these creatures are so big they're going to see us long before we see them.
Look out, Jamie!
Hang on, mate. I'll get him.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Medok throws himself at Jamie, but Ben and Jamie overpower him.

Dialogue.Line: Jamie!
Go on, Ben.
Sit on top of him, Ben.
That's just a
Ben, are you all right?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Then Ola and his guards arrive.

Dialogue.Line: We don't know who you are, strangers, but we are grateful. Medok is one of our last patients in the Colony. We've done our best for him but he gets worse day by day. I wasn't informed you were travelling across our territory. Hurry back to the Colony and tell the Pilot what's happened.
Pilot?
Yes, the Pilot of our Colony. No doubt he will want to thank you in person. Tie him up tighter. Come on, tighter. I don't want any more trouble with him. Come on, I'll show you myself.
Er, any good asking?
Where we are? Well, according to my calculations we're certainly in the future and on a planet very like the Earth.
How do you know?
I don't know. I'm guessing.
My name is Ola. I am the Chief of Police.
That sounds very important.
Oh, it's a very responsible job. I take my instructions from our Control centre. Oh, it all works very well, as you will see. Please follow me.
Oh, thank you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He turns to the guards who are tying up Medok.

Dialogue.Line: Not too tight. It's bad for the blood pressure.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Background music plays throughout, sounding like Ra ra ra ra ra-ra ra ra! Danke shone, danke schone. Number one! Tan tan tan tan tana ta tan! Danke schone two, danke schone two...

Dialogue.Line: Pilot, these are the strangers that have helped us.

Very well, Ola. I will look after our guests. You will no doubt wish to take care of poor Medok. You may leave. Well, our thanks to you and welcome. You are indeed a brave man to tackle someone as disturbed as Medok.
Well, it was nothing. Anyone would have done the same. Well this is gay. Why all the music?
Oh, we regulate our day by music. And now, my friends, I suggest you take advantage of our refreshing department.
Lead me to it mate. I'm starving.
Oh, you will eat later. Here we revive the weary body.
Oh.
Keep your eyes skinned.
Why? What's the matter?
They're a weird sort of folk. I don't know that I understand them.
Come along here, my friends. It's just around the corner.
It's so impressive.
Pilot! Pilot! Control wish you to call them immediately. They wish to welcome our guests.
Oh, but of course. Switch on please, my dear.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A screen lights up with the static picture of a man.

Dialogue.Line: Hey, who's that? He looks smashing.
That's our Controller.

We wish to welcome joyfully the visitors to our colony. We are very grateful to them. They have performed a valuable service. The Colony is to make our guests happy and contented during their stay. Welcome again, friends. Now, back to work everyone.
Well, that was great. I'm really going to enjoy myself.
Splendid! And now, my good friends, let me put you into the hands of our supervisor, Barney. Dear old Barney, everybody calls him.
Thank you, Pilot.
And I must leave you for work calls, you know. And hard work never hurt anybody. Till later.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Pilot leaves.

Dialogue.Line: Delighted to see you. Delighted to have you with us. Now, you have a complete choice of all our treatments. We have steam baths, beauty treatments, perhaps a massage. You, sir, of course, would like your clothes cleaned. And there's sunlight treatment, moonlight treatment, sparkling and effervescent sprays.
I feel perfectly all right as I am, thank you.
Oh go on, Doctor. Don't be such a drag. It all looks super. Please, may I have a shampoo?
Shampoo, of course, for the young lady.
Thanks very much.
And for the young gentlemen, our very latest treatment in our cubicles over there.
Me? Oh, hey, no, you're not going to do that to me. I'm no lassie.
It's no good, Jamie, the lassies have got you., And believe me mate, I'm not going to struggle.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The boys are taken away by two young ladies.

Dialogue.Line: And now, sir, for you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Polly returns.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, very nice. Very nice indeed. You must certainly be the most beautiful young lady in our Colony, and are quite sure to be elected our next beauty president.
Thank you very much.
Oh, not at all. All part of our service. To your liking, sir?
Ah, marvellous. Like being at anchor in the Med.
Some protective oils for our guests and a little suntan.
This the life.
Hey, mister, would you call the ladies off? I'm frightened what they might do to me.
Oh, but you look charming, sir. Charming.
That's what I'm frightened of.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor is in a strange machine. The lid opens to show his hair is neat and flat now.

Dialogue.Line: Please get me out of here. I'm done to a turn.
Clothes reviver.
My clothes don't need reviving.
Oh, while we're about it, sir. And off.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The front of the machine opens. The Doctor comes out immaculately groomed.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, Doctor. You look gorgeous.
Oh, my shoes!
Oh, they're fantastic. You can see your face in them.
Precisely. Who wants to see their face in a pair of suede shoes? What's this one?
Oh, that, sir, is our rough and tumble machine, for toning up the muscles.
Exactly what I need. Full on!
Oh, but no, sir! No!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: General consternation.

Dialogue.Line: But your clothes!
Get out. Oh, come out, Doctor.
Turn it off. Turn it off.
Come out of it.
Come out of it, Doctor.
Oh. Oh, I feel better. Oh, that's more like it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He is back to his previous rumpled self. Jamie enters.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, you look smashing. You really do. You look like a prince. Jamie, that's super. It really is.
Come on, move back. This prisoner's not to be trusted. He's violent and suffering from delusions.
I'm not the one suffering from delusions, it's you. All of you! You don't know what's happening in this Colony.
Be quiet, Medok.
There's only one way to silence me, Ola.
Medok, old fellow, it's Questa. Remember me? What's happened to you?
It's no good. You can't reason with him.
Just a minute. He's an old friend. One of the best.
Ha!
He's as cheerful as any of us. Medok, what's happened to you? What's all this about you seeing things?
I don't see things, Questa, you fool. There are things. Horrible things. Creatures infesting this camp at night.
That's enough. Have you seen the Pilot?
He's with the strangers. I've no idea where they are.
Back to work. Shift rest is over. No time to be lost. The Colony needs you. Preparation to be made for tonight's reception, a welcome for the strangers.
A reception tonight. A Colony party! Medok, join in with the rest of us, like you used to.
It will be fun for all!
Do you hear that, Medok? Fun for all.
All right! Have fun while you can, before they crawl all over you!
That's enough! Right, get back all of you.
There you are. I wondered what had happened to you.
I don't know you. You don't belong here.
Do you belong here?
No, not any more.
We don't talk to him. He sees things. Come on, Medok.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ola pushes Medok through a door, locks it and leaves. The Doctor start to pick the lock. A young woman approaches.

Dialogue.Line: Can I help you?
What? Oh, no. No, its all right, thank you. I just thought I'd dropped something, that's all.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She leaves. The Doctor finishes picking the lock and goes inside.

Dialogue.Line: Ah! What's the game?

I'm going to set you free. Just hold still a minute. There we are. One more. Don't bother to say thank you. Now, tell me something about these things that you see. Do they, for instance, appear to crawl slowly over the ground?
How do you know?
Oh, just wondered, that's all.
Listen.
I don't hear anything.
Someone's coming.
It's all right, I won't let them hurt you.
Get out of my way.
Why don't you listen to me?
I am not being caught!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Medok runs out.

Dialogue.Line: Stop him! Don't let him escape!
How did he get away? Who's responsible? What happened?
I told him he wouldn't get hurt and he wouldn't believe me.
You mean you let him go?
Well, no, not exactly.
He let the prisoner escape. That is a crime in this Colony. For that men must work in the pit. Guards!
You can't touch him. He doesn't know your laws.
That's true, Ola. He is a stranger here.
There's something else you forgetting, gentlemen. I set free someone that we caught in the first place.
True. A reasonable point of view, Ola.
Medok is dangerous. He should have never let him go. The Colony will be petrified when they know he's out there in the night.
Well, send your patrol after him. He can't have got far.
He can run, you know. He's got legs. He doesn't have to crawl over the ground.
Why do you say that?
No reason. No reason at all.
Anyone who spreads that kind of rumour in this Colony will find himself in the hospital for correction.
Oh. Oh, that's where Medok lives, is it?
I think, Doctor, you will understand more about Medok if you talk to some of the people who knew him best.
Pilot, I think
Now take the strangers to the labour centre, Ola. See they learn something about us. Pete, go with him.
Oh. Well, thank you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: On the way to the labour centre they pass a building site. The Doctor spots Medok hiding in the shadows.

Dialogue.Line: What is it? GUARD 2: Nothing, come on.

This is your Controller speaking. There is no need for alarm. You may all continue your work and play confident that the best is being done for you. But our unfortunate companion Medok has been allowed to escape. Emergency Patrols two and three are now searching the Colony, and he is sure to be caught before it is dark. Now, return to your work and play with fresh heart and renewed energy.
They've got that bloke all over the place like a blinking politician.
He is our Controller. We're always pleased to see him. He brings us encouragement.
Oh, he's not a politician then.
Number nine shift to stand by. Leader to report to Youth Centre.
Work shift ready to leave.
(in background) We're happy to work, we're happy to play.)
That's a nice wee tune, Doctor.
Yeah, if you happen to like work.
It's a privilege to work for the Colony.
Shift leader reporting. Shift number nine, all present and correct.
Good. You're the first of the night shifts.
What do you do then? Farming or fishing?
We work very hard here.
Yes, but what do you do?
We tap and refine gas.
For heating?
No, we use it for many things. The Colony depends on it. It's absolutely essential. Emergency!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Two young miners stagger in.

Dialogue.Line: Quick, give me that. Come on.
Accident. Stand by, oxygen supply.
Take them away. Any other losses?
Two with gas sickness. Come on.
What happened?
Their work. It can't be helped. Work must be done.
Do you hear that, Doctor? Where's he gone?
I saw you.
Get out.
Oh, that's not very polite. I was interested in what you were saying.
Who else knows I'm here?
No one. Why should I tell them? Now, these creatures. Have you seen them clearly? What do they look like?
What's it got to do with you?
But I'm interested. What do they look like?
All right, if you really want to know. It's hard to say. They move at night, in the dark. And horrible. Creatures like giant insects.
With big claws?
Yes, that's it.
You've seen them in the Colony?
Oh, yes.
Has anyone else seen them?
A few, but they lock them up in the correction hospital.
Why do they do that?
Control tells them to. They'll put me back there when they catch me. They'll put you back there for helping me. BEN + JAMIE [OC]: Doctor! Doctor!
Go on, quickly. They're looking for you.
Doctor!
But we searched there, I'm sure.
Aye.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Someone is playing a descant recorder.

Dialogue.Line: Were you looking for me? I was just looking around, that's all.
It's dangerous to go off on your own after dark.
Oh, I'm used to the dark. I like it.
We're confined to rest cubicles at night by order of Control. Anyone who wanders round the Colony at night may be killed.
Curfew time. All personnel not on duty must retire to quarters.
Do you hear that?
Emergency patrols two and three to remain on duty. Work shifts to remain at their posts until dawn. Visitors to retire for the night to the refreshing department.
That's you. You're confined here.
Here we are, Doctor. Your young friends are in their rooms over there.
Thank you.
I hope you sleep well.
Oh, I'm sure I will. Thank you. Goodnight.
Goodnight, Doctor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: As soon as Barney is gone the Doctor goes out via the refreshing dept.

Dialogue.Line: It is now dark. No one will go outside into the Colony. A dangerous man is in hiding. Our patrols have orders to shoot on sight. Happy sleep time, everybody.
Same to you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor avoids a patrol lead by Ola. There are very strange night sounds going on.
The crab-like creature vanishes into the night.

Dialogue.Line: That proves it. I wasn't seeing things.
Medok. The guards, they'll hear you.
It doesn't matter. They can't lock me up again. Now I can prove it. We know they're real.
Medok.
Medok. I know you're in there. Come out quietly.
You can put that gun away. I'm coming.
Who's with you?
The Doctor.
What are you doing here?
Don't waste time. Come on over here.
Stay where you are.
Listen, I came out to show you.
Stand still!
It's the Macra, Ola! They are real! Ask the Doctor. He'll tell you.
Yes, I think I can confirm.
We don't want to know what the strangers think.
Well, it might be as well to
Where do you think you're going?
I just thought I'd go and have a look.
Stay where you are. Guard, search him.
What will they do to us?
I'll tell you. You're going before the Pilot. You were in the company of an escaped criminal and you were out in the Colony at night.
I'm sorry, Doctor. I thought he'd listen to reason.
Reason's the last thing a man like Ola will listen to.
You're going to be in trouble, and it's my fault.
Silence! Pilot's headquarters. Move!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Colony Pilot is making his announcements.

Dialogue.Line: Shifts to stand by for greater efforts during working hours. The gas from the pits must be kept in constant supply at even greater pressures. Remember the life of the colony is dependent upon this gas. All industry and activity

Dialogue.Stage Direction: An alarm sounds.

Dialogue.Line: Emergency call. Emergency call.
Yes. Go ahead, Emergency.
Ola requests audience immediately. Ola requests audience immediately.
Look, I'm extremely busy. Unless this is a major crisis, I really don't
Medok has been taken prisoner and one of the strangers has been captured with him.
Bring the stranger in.
Good evening, Pilot. Oh, what a very nice office you have here.
Now what's this all about, Doctor?
Well, I
We found both of them in the new buildings, Pilot.
At night? How did he get there? Wasn't there a guard on his sleeping quarters?
All my guards were out looking for Medok, Pilot.
I see. Very well, you may leave us, Ola. I will conduct the investigation myself.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ola leaves.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, forgive me. This is interesting. A telescopic viewing machine. I imagine you can keep track on the entire Colony from here and direct intercommunication between all parts. Very up to date, I imagine. Excellent, excellent. And what
You don't seem to realise how serious this business is, Doctor. You have committed a crime.
A crime?
What were you doing with Medok? You know he's a dangerous man.
I'm not so sure, Pilot.
You have already been told. He has refused to cooperate and to obey orders. He suffers from hallucinations.
Ah, that's the point. Does he?
What exactly do you mean by that?
Let me perhaps explain.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The intercom buzzes.

Dialogue.Line: What is it now? I've already said I don't want to be interrupted.
Ola reporting, Pilot.
Well, what is it?
Medok has made a statement. It completely changes the situation.
Oh, very well. Bring him in.
I hope you're not going to listen to everything that Medok tells you?
Why, Doctor? Are you afraid of something he might say?
Well, in his state of mind he might say anything.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ola and Medok enter.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor. How have they been treating you?
Silence.
Perfectly all right, thank you.
Medok's made a further statement, Pilot. It's about the Doctor.
Ah.
Ah.
Yes, Medok?
The Doctor wasn't helping me. He was trying to make me give myself up.
Well, that was extremely brave. Why didn't you tell us this?
Well, as a matter of fact
Captain Ola didn't give him a chance.
I see. Well, it seems we owe you an apology, Doctor.
It's better we tell the truth, Doctor.
Yes. Thank you, Medok. I quite understand.
Take him away.
Come on, Medok.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ola and Medok.

Dialogue.Line: Well, I'm extremely sorry about it, Doctor, and of course you're free to go.
What will happen to Medok?

Oh, well, he'll be taken back to the hospital for correction. He'll be given another course of treatment. And when he returns to the Colony, Medok will be a changed man. He will cooperate and he will obey orders. He'll be just like the rest of us.
Why do you want everyone to be the same?

Doctor, this Colony was founded many centuries ago by our ancestors who came from the Earth planet, like your young friends. Our ancestors believed in the virtues of healthy happiness and we have tried to keep their ideals alive. Sometimes, alas, it is necessary to use force. (into intercom) The Doctor will be returning to his quarters now.
The Doctor's escort is ready.
Well, I'm sorry to have disturbed you, Doctor, and many thanks again for your help.
Not at all. Thank you. Goodnight.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor goes to the door, but it is locked.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, I'm so sorry. Goodnight.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor leaves. The screen comes alive with the static image of the Controller.

Dialogue.Line: The Doctor and his friends are to be given the advantage of high powered adaption at once. They must begin to think like members of the Colony. They are to have deep sleep and thinking patterns. We cannot have criticism from these strangers! The work to do it, it must begin immediately.
Emergency order from Control, top priority. Are all the cubicles connected?
The rest cubicles for the four strangers are all connected for deep sleep and thought patterns.
Very good. The process is to begin immediately. Your instructions are being carried out.
That is good. This is an emergency. Control must be believed and obeyed! No one on the Colony believes in Macra! There is no such thing as Macra! Macra do not exist! There are no Macra!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ben is asleep, but Jamie is restless.

Dialogue.Line: The sleeper must relax and believe. Everything in the Colony is good and beautiful. You must accept it without question. You must obey orders. The leaders of the Colony know what is best. In the morning when you wake up you will be given some work. You will be glad to obey. You will question nothing in the Colony.
Ben? Ben?
What is it?
I heard something.
Oh, you're always hearing something.
I never heard a voice like this before. Ben?
I'm asleep.
It was evil, Ben. An evil voice. An evil that spoke so gently and yet I almost believed what it said.
Oh, look, mate, get some sleep. We've got a hard day's work ahead of us tomorrow.
Why do you say that?
Well, we've got to do something to help in the Colony. We can't just eat their nosh without helping out.
You sound just like that voice, Ben.
Oh, what are you on about? This Colony's all right. It wouldn't be too bad to work here.
I never heard you talk that way before, Ben.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ben goes back to sleep.

Dialogue.Line: You will not resist the sleeping gas. Breathe deeply. In the morning, when you wake, you will obey.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor enters, trying not to wake Polly. He examines the wall and finds a hidden wire. He shorts this out, causing a small explosion.

Dialogue.Line: Wake up, Polly.
Doctor? What on earth are you doing?
I've been scotching a rumour. Or should I say scorching.
What happened?
Polly, I think you've been listening to some very bad advice.
But I've been asleep.
Yes, I know you have. Fast asleep. Very fast asleep. Polly, do you smell anything? A sort of sweet perfume?
No.
Never mind. Now, Polly, I want you to forget everything that you've been dreaming.
Why do you say that?

Well, it's just possible that you've been given a series of orders while you've been asleep. You know, do this, do that, do the other thing. My advice to you is don't do anything of the sort. Don't just be obedient. Always make up your own mind. What am I thinking of? Ben and Jamie!
Hello, Doctor. Is it morning?
No, not yet, but nearly so.
What are you up to?
Well, by my calculations, there should be a thin strand of wire in the wall here, like a nerve tapping the subconscious of the human brain.
Lay off, mate. You'll find yourself on a charge.
It should be here somewhere. Ah!
Pack it in, Doctor. The way you mess about you could do some damage.
Better some damage than loss of will power.
What are you on about? Look, get out of it. It's against the law.
What law?
The law of the Colony. Don't do that! (The Doctor shorts the wire.) Now you'll get chucked in jail.
What's the matter with you, Ben? Since when did you start to worry?
He thinks he knows best all the time, but this time he's wrong.
Hey, what's all the noise?
Jamie, how did you sleep?
Oh, very badly, Doctor. I told Ben I kept hearing wee voices.
That's a good sign. That means they haven't been able to get very deeply into your brain.
Ay? I don't understand?
I'll show you. Watch this.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He burns out another circuit

Dialogue.Line: You're fools, all of you! And just look what you've done. You've smashed up all this equipment.
Yes, but look here. If they were trying to make us believe a whole load of rubbish
Rubbish? It's not rubbish. Control knows what's best for us. They want us to cooperate. We should be helping.
What's the matter with you, Ben? This doesn't sound like you at all.
We should learn to obey. The Doctor's causing trouble. I'm going to turn him in.
You don't know what you're doing, Ben.
Get off me!
What's the matter with him?
I'm very much afraid I'm too late.
Ben!
Let go of me.
Ben!
Guards! Guards!
Don't let him go.
No, it's no use, Jamie.
But we cannot let him go, Doctor.
You'll have to. Violence will get you nowhere
Doctor, he's going to go and tell the guards. We've got to get you out of here.
We can't leave Ben.
But he's betrayed you.
No, no, not Ben. He's not in control of his actions. He's been given a series of instructions and he can't help himself.
Yes, but he
That's him! He prodded about in the wall and smashed up our equipment.
This time we've got the evidence, and from one of your own friends. Come on, Doctor.
Leave him alone.
Get out of my way. That's an order.
I take orders from no one but the Doctor.
All right, you're coming too. Get out, both of you!
Thank you, Jamie, but I'd better go with Captain Ola.
But Doctor, what will they do to you?
He should be in that hospital of yours.
You traitor, you.
That's enough!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ola leaves with the Doctor and Jamie

Dialogue.Line: The hospital! He needs correction more than Medok does.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Medok is strapped to a bed. The voice drones on in the background.

Dialogue.Line: You wish to cooperate. You have seen no strange creatures. You will work hard and happily. Hard and happily. You wish to cooperate. You have seen no strange creatures.
It's a very difficult case, I'm afraid. Nothing much we can do. He's too far gone to help. No, he'll never be happy like the rest of us. All we can do is send him to the pits for life.
Can't hide the truth.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: An intercom buzzes.

Dialogue.Line: Yes, what is it? What's that? The Doctor? I'll come at once. Keep at it.
What did you do it for? The Doctor's our friend.
I had to do my duty.
Well, you go on doing it, then. I'm going to go and find out where the others have gone.
Look, Polly, you'd better stay here.
Go on, report me.
Now look. Come back, Polly. Polly? Polly!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ben is searching the site.

Dialogue.Line: Polly, where are you? Polly? You'll be in trouble. Don't fool about, Polly. You must obey Control. Polly? Stop!
Leave me alone!
You're coming back to the guard.
What's the matter with you, Ben? Wake up!
You're coming with me, girl. You broke the Colony law.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Polly screams.

Dialogue.Line: What's the matter with you?
There.
There's nothing there.
But there was. I saw it. A huge face, like an insect, or a giant crab. It was horrible and it was looking at us and it had claws. Claws like we saw on the time scanner.
There's nothing there. Come on.
No, not that way.
Look, you're just trying to dodge off.
No, no, please, I'm not. But please look.
There is nothing there!
Ben.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Something appears.

Dialogue.Line: What is it?
I don't know.
Well, what are we going to do?
There is nothing evil or harmful in this colony.
How can you believe that stuff?
It stands to reason. It's safe. There is nothing here!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A giant claw grabs Polly, who naturally screams. Ben grabs a piece of timber and hits it to no effect.

Dialogue.Line: Ben, what is this? Get it off me, Ben! It's got my foot! Ben! Help me, Ben! Help me!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Eventually the creature lets Polly go, and leaves.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, it was horrible!
It's all right. I think it's going away.
Let's go inside. Ben, behind you! There's another one! Ben, they're all around us!
Look, Polly, you make a run for it, and I'll keep them here.
No, you won't stand a chance.
We can't stop here. Come on, quick!
Take them out of here. They're condemned to the pits.
Come on. Get out, all of you. Out! Get out!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor, Polly and Jamie are taken away.

Dialogue.Line: (to intercom) Stand by work shift. Stand by in the pits.
Work shift standing by.
The strangers are being sent to you for pit labour. Put them in the Danger Gang.
Your orders are correct, Pilot. The strangers must be sent to explore the new gas reserve. They are dangerous people. They must be disciplined.
Yes, Control.
You will forget all that happened.
Yes, Control.
The Colony enjoys hard work and happiness. We will not tolerate the evil of such strangers.
Yes, Control. You must serve the Colony. Keep watch on your friends and if you see anything suspicious, report to me immediately.
Yes, Pilot.
We are all happy to work. We are all happy to work. For the good of the Colony. Happy to work. Happy to work.
Oh!
What's the matter?
Dreadful. Did you hear that rhyme? The man who wrote that ought to be sent to the Danger Gang, not us.
All right. That's enough.
Ah, are these the three strangers?
Yes.
Yes, you might call us that.
They've been allocated 176 shift.
Oh, very good, Ola. I'll recall the shift leader.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He does so as the Doctor speaks over him.

Dialogue.Line: What an extremely remarkable place. What efficiency. Whatever do you make?
Silence.
I thought this was a mine, you know, where you dig up coal?
Ah, yes, but here, you see, the rock foundation is a type of salt. Now at depths it generates gases, over the years, and these gases are extremely valuable.
Don't bother to explain to them. Just get them to work.
Aye. well, you don't send a lassie and an old man down to dig.
Old? What do you mean old? I'm not old, Jamie.
You'll do as you're ordered.
Here's the leader of the their shift, sir.
Very well. Report any irregularities to me.
Medok! How did you get here?
They threw me out of the correction hospital. Apparently I'm a hopeless case.
But why did they send you here?
The one remaining punishment they could think of. To work in the Danger Gang for life.
For life?
Oh, don't worry, you don't survive long in this atmosphere. It's the gas. It gets everywhere. It creeps into your lungs. And when you're down there, you're right in the thick of it.
Come on, Medok. Take them to their work.
What's the hurry?
You don't want me to call the guard, do you?
All right, all right, we're going. But we are entitled to a supervisor on this shift.
Oh, yes, that's true.
Yes. Well, I'm leaving this man.
Hmm? Oh, well, yes. I suppose that's all right.
But it's much safer up here. Isn't it, Medok?
It is.
Ah. I see. I'm perfectly capable of working in the pit, thank you. Polly can have the safe job.
Oh no, you stay up here, Doctor. I wouldn't know what to do.
Well, I'm not sure I understand all this machinery myself.
Do you not think you might make better use of the opportunity, Doctor?
What do you mean? Oh, yes. Oh, yes. Yes, I'll be supervisor.
What was all that?
Nothing. Absolutely nothing.
Come on, you two.
Oh, you're going to issue them with masks, aren't you? You aren't taking them down there without any protection?
Surely you could have seen to that? Oh, here. You'd better take this checklist.
But would have liked a mask.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The group head for the underground shaft as Ben enters.

Dialogue.Line: This really is remarkable. Most interesting. Yes, I suppose with a little adjustment. Hello, Ben. Don't go. Come in. Don't be afraid.
I have nothing to be afraid of.
No, of course not. It wasn't your fault you betrayed your friends.
The voices tell me what to do.
The voices may not be right, Ben.
I do what I am told.
Yes, I know. That's why you're here, isn't it? To spy on me. What does Control want to know this time? Can't you answer me? You know, Ben, this is very unlike you.
I don't know what you mean. It is my duty.
It's hard for you to struggle against the voices, isn't it, Ben? But I warn you, if you spy on the others, watch out Jamie doesn't catch you. He's not so tolerant as I am.
Hurry up. Put on your equipment.
You shouldn't make lassies do the work of men.
The Danger Gang will do as they are told. It's a punishment for their failure to cooperate.
We do all the dirty work. We go where the gas is worst.
It's your own fault, Medok. If you obeyed Control
All right. All right. Forget it. I prefer Control poisoning my lungs to their trying to poison my mind.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: An alarm sounds.

Dialogue.Line: What's that?
It's a gas strike.
Go on. Help with the cable there. Go on, hurry up. That's the alarm. This gas is lethal.
What does he mean?
He means they've struck so much gas they can't channel it off. When it reaches a certain density, that alarm bell goes.
Hurry up! Get that cable to the strike.
Come on, quickly.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Polly, Jamie, and Medok help other workers drag the cable along the shaft.

Dialogue.Line: Quickly. Come on. Pull there. Pull, all of you. Pull! Pull!
Polly!
Leave her. Get that cable to the strike.
Get her away from here. Away. Jamie, the head of the cable, got it! Right! Now put your masks on. They're in your pockets. Right, now help me with this. Hold it. Hold it, Jamie, hold it. Right.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The leak is sealed.

Dialogue.Line: What's it all for?
For a poisonous gas which we mine from the bowels of this planet, which kills us if we breathe it. No one knows what it's used for.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor is chalking calculations on the wall.

Dialogue.Line: Yes. Now, one must assume that the relative connection is constant. Now, let me see. Ah. Yes, I think that's right. I shall give myself ten out of ten.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Pilot enters.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, you did give me a turn.
Where did you find it?
What?
The formula.
In my head. You know.
Don't lie. That is a secret known only to three people in the Colony.
And you're one of them, I'd say.
Naturally. And you're not asking me to believe that in a few moments you have been able to work out a formula which it has taken our combined computers years to perfect?
It does seem rather a tall order.
Yes, of course. I know what you've done. You've broken into our secret files, haven't you?
I wouldn't know how to do that. Take a look.
Well, you must have seen the document. That's the exact computation.
Really? Huh. In that case

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He alters his mark to eleven out of ten.

Dialogue.Line: Do you really mean to say that you worked that out by yourself?
Well, I did have a little assistance.
Yes, I thought so. Who was it?

Oh, no, no, no. Oh, no. No person. No. I simply mean that I took readings from the various dials. They appeared to be related, so I worked out the principle that controlled them. It was simple really. Like doing a sum backwards.
Backwards?
Yes. You know. Given the answer, what's the question?
Wipe it away. Get it off there before anybody else sees it.
Oh well, if you insist.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor throws a bucket of water at the wall.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, there now. If anyone follows that formula there'll be an almighty explosion. X to the power of y is derivative 2 3's of 6!
Get it off.
What are they doing?
We call that probing.
They're not looking for more gas?
Oh, yes. We never stop.
There's a door here. Where does it lead to?
I've no idea. To my knowledge those doors were never opened.
Could be an old shaft.
Why would it need such a new door? And so strong?
Hey, look out!
Ah, you've made the connection?
Of course. Otherwise you wouldn't be here.
Now, be careful, Medok. There are other places worse than the Danger Gang, you know. This is a high pressure strike. You are going to need a stronger screw than this.
Don't touch it.
I know what I'm doing.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ben watching a leak of gas catch Officia, who staggers back. Medok hammers the screw back and Jamie takes Officia's keys.

Dialogue.Line: He's fainted.
Aye. He must have.
What's the matter? What has happened to him?
He's had a wee whiff of the gas.
Get him up. I'll look after him. Yeah, it's all right, mate. Hang on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ben helps Officia away.

Dialogue.Line: How long do you think Ben was watching us?
I don't know.
Do you think he saw you take the keys?
Well, if he did, we're in trouble.
Yes.
It just means we'll have to make use of them as quick as we can.
But where, Jamie. And how?
Let's try that wee door first. Come on. Give me the word if anybody comes.
Right. Look out. Okay.
Hey you two, give us a hand.
All right. I'd better go.
Just a minute Polly. This key's turning. Oh.
Good luck.
Aye. It fits. Come on, Pol.
Come on here, everybody. Lend a hand.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie is through the door, and goes carefully along the shaft.
An alarm sounds.

Dialogue.Line: What's that?
It's impossible.
Is it more gas?
No, it's an escape. That bell means that someone has escaped down here.
It's Jamie.
Your friend? That door! I'm going with him.
Hey, wait! Don't leave me down here.
We couldn't have an alarm. It's impossible. No one ever escapes. Calling Pit Guard. Close exits to all gas shafts. Stand by. A prisoner has escaped. Shoot on sight.
But, if no one can escape
My keys. My keys! They were on my tunic.
You must have dropped them.
Special guards to cover all exits to the old shaft. With Pilot's permission, they may have to go on forbidden ground.
Jamie? Jamie? Jamie? Ah!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A huge claw grabs Medok by the throat and throws him to the ground.

Dialogue.Line: Hello? Who's there?

No permission is granted for the guard to go on forbidden ground. Repeat, no permission. They are not to cover the exit to the old shaft. This is in use at this moment by Control. No one is to go in or near the old shaft. Top priority.
They seem very emphatic about that.
Control knows best.
But what if your prisoner escapes that way? What will happen to you?
I shall be punished.
Well, aren't you going to do something about it?
Control knows best.
Who has escaped, anyway?
We shall soon find out.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Officia leaves.

Dialogue.Line: It is Jamie.
How do you know that, Ben?
I saw him take the keys.
And you didn't report it?
No.
Why not?
I don't know. I don't seem to be able to think straight.
Ben, you're recovering. I always thought you were a tough customer. Well done.
Control knows best.
You don't seem very sure.
Jamie took those keys. I must report him.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie goes back and finds Medok lying on the ground. Something moves in the shadows, then Jamie is face to face with a Macra.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, you know what's happened?
Yes. Jamie's got free. By my calculations he's got a very good chance. Hold that for me, will you?
What do you mean?
Well, as I understand it, Jamie's in the old shaft.
Yes, that's right.
And for reasons of their own, Control don't want anyone there. It's forbidden territory.
So you think he'll be all right?
I don't know. I'll be able to tell you when I've tested this to see how lethal it is.
But what's that got to do with Jamie?
On this planet it's got a lot to do with everybody. There now. Yes.
Oh, Doctor, what on earth are you doing?
I'm trying to analyse this gas, and I'm not having very much luck.
Is that the same stuff that we've been pumping out of the pits?
Yes. And they go to great efforts to get it. The question is why?
Shh! Somebody's coming.
Oh! Mustn't find this.
Oh, the Pilot's not here. Let me help you.
No.
Always lend a helping hand. A willing friend makes the task lighter.
I'll wait for the Pilot, if I'm going to tell anybody.
You are, aren't you?
I don't know what I'm going to do. I've got these voices in my head. Sometimes I just think I'm having a bad dream.
But the voices are here to help us. They are our friends.
That's it. What about my friends?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Macra is still. Jamie throws a stone then some salt rock at it. It doesn't move, then its eyes open.

Dialogue.Line: I'll see you're reported for this. If this were not an emergency
The bell's stopped. Why has it stopped?
Because, young lady, the emergency's over.
Does that mean he's been caught?
It means they're closing in on him.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Macra is staring at Jamie.

Dialogue.Line: Thank you. But why didn't you tell this to Officia?
You told me to report back to you.
I see. Very well. The stranger who has escaped is in the old shaft. Control will now give instructions.

All guards will leave the area of the old shaft. No one must go near it, even in search of the stranger. Do not approach its exit or entrance. Do not go in. Officials are to stand by at the gas centre.
We will obey, Control.
Retain full pressure.
Full pressure is being maintained on master control. Reserves are standing by.
Let me see, let me see.
Doctor, what could be happening to Jamie now?
I hate to think. It won't be anything very pleasant. Polly, go and see what the first dial on the control desk registers.
Right.
Hurry up.
Full pressure.
Full pressure. And the other one? Come on.
Zero.
Zero. Now I think there's only one thing for it. Plus must be made minus and minus must be made plus.
What's the matter?
The question is, which is plus and which is minus?
Oh.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie is trapped between two Macra. Jamie spots a crevice in the rock face and hides in there. In the pithead, the Doctor is tapping pipes.

Dialogue.Line: What are you doing?
Oh, just checking.
Well, I don't need your help, thank you.
As you please. But I think you're going to run into trouble.
Why? What's the matter?
Well, according to my calculations, the pressure gauges are wrong.
Don't be ridiculous.

Ridiculous? Well, that's as may be. But, after all, three times three is nine, and if you divide by half of its own cubic capacity to the formula Pi over four squared, I think you'll have to agree with me.
Don't touch that.
Why not?
That controls the inflow system.
Oh. So these are the inflow pipes, are they? That's all I wanted to know.
But what are you doing?
Inflow. Inflow. Outflow. Inflow. High pressure. Low pressure and O-U-T spells out.
Doctor, what are you doing?
It's all right, Polly, confusion is best left to the experts.
But stop it. You've no idea what you're doing.
Oh yes, I have. I can stand an operation on its head quicker than anyone. There! I think you'll find I've revolutionised the entire gas flow of the Colony.
You must be mad. You'll be locked up.
Polly, see what those dials register now.
Right. Doctor, something's happened to this one.
What does it read?
It's reads zero.
And the other one?
Full pressure.
Good. Splendid. That means there'll be a fine old gale of fresh air blowing along the old shaft any time now.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Macra are trying to prise Jamie from his hiding place, and despite his best efforts they succeed. He is engulfed by a landslide of salt rock.

Dialogue.Line: You can do nothing. You'll only delay matters. It's a simple matter for me to reconnect the gas.
Yes, I'm sure it is. But I'm sure you'd like a little help.
Now stop that. You've enough to answer for already. Guard! Guard!
It's all right, Polly, I've got his keys. Lock the door.
Send the guard, immediately!
They're bound to get in sooner or later.
Yes, well, the later the better. The only thing we can do for Jamie now is to give him time. Lock the door.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie struggles free from the salt rock and fights the Macra. As the fresh air fills the shaft, both Macra start to slump.

Dialogue.Line: This is Control. Why has the outflow of gas stopped? Gas must be pumped into the old shaft without interruption. Begin pumping immediately.
I need help immediately. The strangers obey nothing. They are turning taps in the wrong direction.
Guards have been detailed to assist you.
Open up in there!
The keys. My keys. Where are my keys?
Oh, dear. Your keys. Try in your pocket. Or on the gantry. Or over there.
Look, I know you've got them.
Doctor, the door.
Open up in there or we'll smash it in.
It's going to give way.
Come on, Polly. Let's get out of here.
No, not that way. It goes to the pits. Quick. Try that one.
It's locked.
Then use the keys! Quick, Doctor, quick!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The guards burst through the doors.

Dialogue.Line: Over there. Quick! Stop them before they do any damage. OLA: Get them!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The guards hurry to the metal door and try to stop it closing.

Dialogue.Line: Push, Polly, push!
I can't!
You've got to. Come on, together. I've nearly got it locked. There we are.
Where are we?
Well, it looks rather like a cupboard with a lot of pipes.
Where do you suppose they lead?
They must lead somewhere. Let's have a look.
Doctor, I think these are the pipes that carry the poisonous gas.
Yes, very likely.
Well, don't you think we'd better stay here?
Stay here? I'm not spending the rest of my life with a lot of old pipes.
But Doctor
Now, come along Polly. I'm sure there's no need to be afraid. Well, well I think there's no need to be afraid. Oh, come on. Let's find out.
There, that ought to do it. Let's hope we're not too late.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie examines the walls for a way out. He forces open a rusty grating, and crawls through.
Jamie falls into a large cupboard. He can hear voices in the hall next door.

Dialogue.Line: What do you know?
We all know Control is right, and we must obey!
Let them know. Let them know.
Let them know they're happy!
Greet the morning with a shout.
Everyone up. The sun is out.
Rah, rah, rah!
Rah, rah, rah! Cheers for the Colony. We're the gang that works the hardest, and we must obey. Obey Control. Ring the bell.
Rah, rah, rah!
Rah, rah, rah!
Work well.
Ring the bell!
Oh, that's much better. But we'll do it again, and this time with more feeling. Ah! And don't forget our job is to inspire the others. Our brave workers who are doing such a dangerous job. All right?
All right!
What do you know?
We all know Control is right, and we must obey!
Let them know. Let them know.
Let them know they're happy!
Greet the morning with a shout.
Everyone up. The sun is out.
Rah, rah, rah!
Rah, rah, rah!
Oh, that's very good! That's beginning to sound like something. It still needs a bit more clarity, and I think that the girls could. Say! how did you get there?
Oh, well, er, I just, as a matter of fact
Oh, I see. You're one of the dancers.
One of the dancers? Oh, I'm afraid. Aye. Aye, yes. I'm one of the dancers.
And you got your dance ready?
My dance? Ah. Well, er, yes. Yes, it's ready.
Well, go ahead. I'll see it now.
You'll see it now?
And don't forget you have to be very good to get into the Happy Colony finals. We want something gay and cheerful.
Gay and cheerful?
Have you any music?
Oh, no. I don't need it.
Go ahead. We'll pick up the rhythm and clap to it. All right?
All right!
Well, come on. Get on with it. We haven't got all day.
Oh, aye.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie starts dancing. The others clap in time to his steps.

Dialogue.Line: That's very good. What do you call it?
The Highland Fling.
Why do you call it the Highland Fling?
Because we finish the dance by flinging ourselves out the door.
Oh, that's very good! Come on now. Rah, rah, rah!
Rah, rah, rah!
Cheers for the Colony. Rah, rah, rah!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie has flung himself out the door and into the guards.

Dialogue.Line: Where did this boy come from?
Oh, he's one of the dancers.
Nonsense. He's the escaped stranger. You there, identify him. Is this the boy you reported?
(hesitant) Yes.
Ben, you gave me away.
Tie him up. Go to the Pilot. Tell him the stranger's found. Tell him it won't be long before we get our hands on his friends as well.
Jamie, I'm

No permission for the guards to go on forbidden ground. Repeat, no permission. They are not to cover the exit to the old shaft. This is in use at this moment by Control. No one is to go near the old shaft.
Shh. I hear voices. Very faint.
I don't hear anything.
Stay here a minute, Polly.
No, don't leave me.
The search for the other strangers must be carried on.
It's the Controller. The voice behind the screen.
All guards are detailed to hunt for the Doctor and the girl. They must be taken dead or alive.
Look! He must be there.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Polly climb a ladder towards a port hole. They see a Macra inhaling the gas.
The Doctor and Polly are looking in.

Dialogue.Line: This is Control. The day shift is to begin work in the emergency gas shaft. All pressures are to be maintained. The Colony cannot live without gas.
So that's where all the gas goes.
Yes, just as I thought. These creatures would die without it.
But how long have they been there? I mean, they weren't always in control, were they?
I couldn't tell you when they were here in the first place, Polly. They're like germs in the human body. They've got into the body of this colony. They're living as parasites.
You make it sound like a disease.
Polly, that's what I think they are.
They're in the control room. It must be like getting into the brain, mustn't it?
Yes, very likely.
Shh. They might hear you.
Now then. One system must provide them with the gas they need, and the other one must be an outflow.
Doctor, we've got to bring the Pilot here, and then we can show him these creatures really do exist.
Yes, Polly. I think it might work.
(to Jamie) Look at me when I talk to you.
Ola, a word with you. Where exactly did you catch him?
In here. In the hall, Pilot.
I see. So in fact, he gave himself up?
He should never have been allowed to escape.
Are you criticising Control?
I'm criticising the running of the pits.
But that is my job, Ola.
I know that. But were it not for my guards, this stranger would still be a danger to all of us. I am going to report to Control that there is no discipline in the pits.
That's not the only report Control will get!
Ever since these strangers arrived your authority in this Colony has gone to pieces. They come and go as they please, and even now two of them are still missing.

Good morning. Good morning. Good morning. Well, everyone is up bright and early. And the last two strangers are not missing after all. Oh, come now. We can't have bad temper and differences of opinion in this happy type colony. Say you're sorry, Ola. Say you're sorry, Pilot.
Doctor, what did ye come here for? You've walked into a trap.
Good morning, Jamie. It's nice to see you so well cared for.
Yes, but Doctor
Oh, it's all right. I've just come in to have a word with my old friend, the Pilot. Good morning, Ben. I hope you're feeling more your old self?
Yes, Doctor. I am.
Why did not your guards arrest these strangers?
I don't know. Guards, arrest them.
That is no longer necessary.
Of course not. You can't arrest us now we've given ourselves up. That's against the rules.
Now. You wish to see me?
Yes, I do, urgently. Come with me.
This is Control. Everyone is to return to work immediately. This order includes all executives. It includes the Pilot. Everyone back to work immediately.
Well, I shall have to go.
No, wait. You must listen to what the Doctor's got to tell you. They're only saying that because they know what we've seen.
At once!
Pilot.
At once! That is an order!
Don't take any notice of them. That's not your Controller. Those are your enemies.
There must be no discussion with the strangers!
Why not?
Aye, what are you afraid of?
Arrest the strangers! That is an order! All the strangers!
That doesn't sound like a man in control.
What did you wish to tell me?
Pilot, you heard Control. Guards, take them all away.
I am still the Pilot here. You will take your orders from me. Get back to your quarters.
Contact Control immediately. Report the Pilot!
That was a very brave thing to do.
Or very foolish. What is it you wanted to tell me?
Come with me.
Pilot!
You will all remain here.
He disobeyed Control. The Pilot will be arrested.
No.
Anything may happen now, Jamie. We've got to be ready to run for it.
We can't leave the Doctor.
He'll be back in a minute, and Ben seems to be all right now.
Aye, more like the old Ben, I must admit. But you still canna. Where is he?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ben is hiding amongst the instruments, watching the Doctor and Pilot.

Dialogue.Line: But, Doctor, this is forbidden territory.
Yes and you'll soon see why.
Stop! Stop! You're breaking the law!
Bad laws were made to be broken. Follow me.
But

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Pilot go into the Pipe room

Dialogue.Line: What's happened to the Pilot, Ola? The strangers have changed him!
The Pilot is a traitor.
The Pilot has no more authority. Ola is in command!
I really don't know why I trust you, Doctor.
Oh, perhaps I've got an honest face.
The Pilot is to be arrested! This is a happy Colony! All must obey!
Did you hear that?
Don't give up now. It's just up here.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Pilot climb the ladder.

Dialogue.Line: All guards to report to the pit head. They are to take orders from Ola. Is this understood?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Pilot look through the port hole into the Control room full of Macra.

Dialogue.Line: There you are. That's what's taken over this Colony. You haven't been in touch with Control, but with these. They've used this Colony for their own ends, destroying you to live themselves.
Why, they're horrible. No, Doctor. It is they who must be destroyed. We must kill them.
They're here!
Let's go.
The Pilot and the stranger! In forbidden territory! They must be destroyed!
What are they, Doctor? I mean, some monstrous form of bacteria? Insects? Or what?
I don't know, but you must fight them.
How?
Take full command!
You mean defy Control?
Well, you see what Control really is.
Yes. You're right, Doctor. They must be destroyed.
We've been waiting for you.
Ola, the Colony is in the hands of grotesque insects!
So you've been seeing things?
They're in there. The Macra!
You know what happens to people that say that.
But I
Now we can deal with you all together.
Did the Pilot has see them?
Yes, I saw the Macra.
It is forbidden to say that. Don't let him say that he has seen Macra!
I saw you! You are the Macra!
Silence! Silence the three strangers! That is an order!
What shall we do with them, Control?
Return them to the pipe room. The three strangers and the Pilot. They are to be locked in, and you will not let them out.
Come on, get in.
Ola.
Doctor!
Come on, you heard Control. Get in.
You'll suffer for this, you wait and see.
Don't worry Polly, I'll look after you.
No!
Take your hands off her.
Get in!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor, Polly, Jamie, and the Pilot are locked in the pipe room.

Dialogue.Line: You have done well, Ola.
What instructions, Control?
Clear the building. Guards and workers are to return to the hall for music.
I obey, Control.
It will take precisely four minutes, and then it will be safe for everyone to return to work. Four minutes.
Why four minutes?
Aye, what can they do in four minutes, Doctor?
I don't know. We must be ready for anything.
It's the gas! It's coming in here.
Pilot, do you know where it's coming from?
Why, no. I've never been here before.
There must be a hidden inlet.
You will not be able to fight it. You cannot stop it.
Doctor, I'm getting dizzy.
Polly, hold that in front of your mouth.
It's coming from over here, Doctor!
I think you're right, Jamie.
It's coming from here as well!
You are unable to stop it.
Polly!
It will not last long. Only for four minutes. By that time you
Let us out. Let us out!
Will be completely helpless. Not quite dead, but helpless.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ben knocks on the door.

Dialogue.Line: Hello in there.
Who is it?
Ben.
Ben? Is that you? Are you all right?
Can you open the door from your side?
No.
But it's locked. There isn't a key.
Ben, listen.
We've got very little time. It's all up to you.
Go ahead Doctor. Tell me what to do.
Go to the control desk, and you'll see two switches, one marked outflow and one marked inflow.
Hang on.
The other stranger has recovered. He is now dangerous! He will no longer obey Control. The fourth stranger is trying to help his friends. He is no longer one of us. He must be stopped at once!
I've got them, Doc. Two switches. What next?
Good. You see a lever in front of them?
Yeah.
It is forbidden to touch that instrument! You must not obey the Doctor! You will kill us all! He intends to create an explosion!
Come away from those instruments! You will destroy the Colony!
Oh, shut up. Okay, Doctor. Fire away.
Guards! Stop the strangers!
Switch on both inflow and outflow.
No! Stop! The pressure will be unbearable! Oh, for human beings as well.
Switch them on, Ben. Then stand by to throw the lever.
You are to give no such order!
Inflow on. Outflow on. Okay, Doc. Ready with the lever.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There is hammering on the main door.

Dialogue.Line: Quickly, Doctor!
Throw the lever away from you.
No! No! Don't let him.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There are sounds of explosions.

Dialogue.Line: No!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There is music and dancing. Jamie does his Highland Fling to the delight of the colonists.

Dialogue.Line: Now, my first duty is to thank the strangers, for they have saved our Colony.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The colonists cheer.

Dialogue.Line: A dance festival will be held every year in their memory, and the winners will be awarded the Strangers' Trophy.
Where's the Doctor?
Why, he's right over there.
Well, I've got a tipoff he'll want to hear. Hey, Doctor? Doctor?
Relax. Relax. More haste, more waste. Pleasure is beautiful.
Relax? You wait till you hear what they're going to do with you.
Oh, well.
Yeah, I just heard it on the grapevine. They're going to draft us as members of the Colony, and make you the next Pilot.
They can't do that to me. Let's get out of here.
Yes, but how?
Take a leaf out of Jamie's book. Give them the old dance routine.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor, Polly, Jamie and Ben dance enthusiastically, slowly moving closer to the door.
